org.threadly.concurrent
Interface PrioritySchedulerInterface

All Superinterfaces:
java.util.concurrent.Executor, SimpleSchedulerInterface
All Known Implementing Classes:
PriorityScheduledExecutor, PrioritySchedulerWrapper, TestablePriorityScheduler
public interface PrioritySchedulerInterface
extends SimpleSchedulerInterface

This interface represents schedulers which can not only execute and schedule tasks, but run based off a given priority as well.

Method Summary
 void execute(java.lang.Runnable task, TaskPriority priority)
          Executes the task as soon as possible with the given priority.

          Get the default priority for the scheduler.

Method Detail

execute

void execute(java.lang.Runnable task,
             TaskPriority priority)
Executes the task as soon as possible with the given priority.

Parameters:
task - runnable to execute
priority - priority for task

submit

java.util.concurrent.Future<?> submit(java.lang.Runnable task,
                                      TaskPriority priority)
Submit a task to run as soon as possible. There is a slight increase in load when using submit over execute. So this should only be used when the future is necessary. The future .get() method will return null once the runnable has completed.

Parameters:
task - runnable to be executed
priority - priority for task
Returns:
a future to know when the task has completed

submit

<T> java.util.concurrent.Future<T> submit(java.util.concurrent.Callable<T> task,
                                          TaskPriority priority)
Submit a callable to run as soon as possible. This is needed when a result needs to be consumed from the callable.

Parameters:
task - callable to be executed
priority - priority for callable
Returns:
a future to know when the task has completed and get the result of the callable

schedule

void schedule(java.lang.Runnable task,
              long delayInMs,
              TaskPriority priority)
Schedule a task with a given delay and a specified priority.

Parameters:
task - runnable to execute
delayInMs - time in milliseconds to wait to execute task
priority - priority to give task for execution

submitScheduled

java.util.concurrent.Future<?> submitScheduled(java.lang.Runnable task,
                                               long delayInMs,
                                               TaskPriority priority)
Schedule a task with a given delay and a specified priority. There is a slight increase in load when using submitScheduled over schedule. So this should only be used when the future is necessary. The future .get() method will return null once the runnable has completed.

Parameters:
task - runnable to execute
delayInMs - time in milliseconds to wait to execute task
priority - priority to give task for execution
Returns:
a future to know when the task has completed

submitScheduled

<T> java.util.concurrent.Future<T> submitScheduled(java.util.concurrent.Callable<T> task,
                                                   long delayInMs,
                                                   TaskPriority priority)
Schedule a callable with a given delay. This is needed when a result needs to be consumed from the callable.

Parameters:
task - callable to be executed
delayInMs - time in milliseconds to wait to execute task
priority - priority to give task for execution
Returns:
a future to know when the task has completed and get the result of the callable

scheduleWithFixedDelay

void scheduleWithFixedDelay(java.lang.Runnable task,
                            long initialDelay,
                            long recurringDelay,
                            TaskPriority priority)
Schedule a recurring task to run and a provided priority. The recurring delay time will be from the point where execution finished.

Parameters:
task - runnable to be executed.
initialDelay - delay in milliseconds until first run.
recurringDelay - delay in milliseconds for running task after last finish.
priority - priority for task to run at

getDefaultPriority

TaskPriority getDefaultPriority()
Get the default priority for the scheduler.

Returns:
the set default task priority
